definition: to display shockingly bad behavior/to behave atrociously
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to scatter/to sprinkle/to spill

old variant of 野[ye3]
field/plain/open space/limit/boundary/rude/feral

sentences.english: Face lane after disfiguring, another no an dared apt come apt her this pure Quan Yuan to"act boorishly".
sentences.chinese: 脸弄毁容后，就再没有人敢来她这清绻苑“撒野”了。

sentences.english: Don't rough them up in the game.They are still boys.
sentences.chinese: 比赛时别对他们撒野，他们还是些孩子。

sentences.english: Dragging children, do not let their children act wildly complex and self-destruction.
sentences.chinese: 二是紧紧拖住孩子，不要让孩子撒野毁物和自毁。

sentences.english: What does he come here cheeking us for, then?
sentences.chinese: 他干嘛来咱们这儿撒野？

sentences.english: Most of crucian carp, lives in in running water wild.
sentences.chinese: 大部分是鲫鱼，没命地在湍急的流水中撒野。

sentences.english: This side of Bruce Lee is not working, he as usual act wildly.
sentences.chinese: 此方对李小龙则不灵，他照常撒野。

sentences.english: They ran riot through the town after the defeat of their team.
sentences.chinese: 自己的球队输了以后，他们在小镇上到处撒野。

definition: wanton/unbridled/presumptuous/impudent
to show off one's military strength (idiom); to strut around/to bluff/to bluster
to enter without permission/to trespass
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
regardless of the law and of natural morality (idiom); maverick/undisciplined and out of control
to dare (negative connotation)/to have the audacity to (do sth)
to have the impertinence/to have the cheek to
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to court death/taking risks

tyrannical abuse (idiom); riding roughshod over people

to act willfully and make a scene/to make trouble
to run amok (idiom); to commit outrages
